properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 9:13AM MST until February 3 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Major Winter Storm is expected this Afternoon through Monday
Night...

.A cold front move into northern Wyoming by noon. This cold front
will drop southward to the Continental Divide by around sunset,
and then move into southwest Wyoming tonight. The snow is expected
to occur in the north this afternoon and progress south tonight.
This storm system will impact most areas through Monday evening,
then taper off late Monday night. The heaviest snowfall looks to
occur tonight through Monday afternoon.

* WHAT...Moderate to Heavy snow.

* WHERE...Absaroka Mountains and Cody Foothills.

* WHEN...From noon today to 11 PM MST Monday.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...6 to 11 inches in the Cody Foothills and 8 to
15 inches in the Absaroka Mountains. Locally higher snowfall
totals may occur.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be very difficult tonight through Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of north wind 15 to 25 mph will
cause some blowing and drifting snow.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST MONDAY
